title: 200 transactions at max included into block from tx pool (DEV chain)
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon version 2022.99.99-dev-6371cd7b` (also reproduced on alpha - erigon version 2022.08.2-alpha-35c4faa1
)

OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX

Commit hash : 35c4faa1b41e8379a74d0385505add0dd450c2ed

NOTE: it's very similar to https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/4771. However, - #4771 is about how many blocks are needed to distribute transactions from transaction pool.
Current issue is about how many transactions are included into single block


#### Expected behaviour
Block includes `blockGasLimit / Σ (transaction gasLimit)` number of transactions

#### Actual behaviour
200 transactions limit at max is included into block from tx pool (DEV chain)



#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
In order to reproduce you need to have 800+ transactions with 21000 gas are present in transaction pool
There are several approaches:
1) Start erigon without mining: 
```./erigon --datadir=dev --chain dev --private.api.addr=localhost:9091 --http=false --http.port=8545 ```
2) Start RPC daemon:
```./rpcdaemon --datadir=dev --private.api.addr=localhost:9091 --http.api=eth,erigon,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool,parity --http.port 8545 ```
2) Send 800+ valid transactions with 21000 gas limit (transaction sending ETH from one account to another)
4) Stop erigon process
5) Start erigon with `--mine` now
```./erigon --datadir=dev --chain dev --private.api.addr=localhost:9091 --mine --http=false --http.port=8545 ```
6) Pay attention on how many transactions included into first block after erigon started

#### Backtrace

@leonardchinonso yes :), thanks for the heads-up! I will pick up - I'm the 'umbrella' for a team of us working
it's hardcoded here: `cfg.txPool2.Best(200, &txSlots, tx)`. Just change constant or get more transactions in loop until have free space in block.

Thanks 

> it's hardcoded here: `cfg.txPool2.Best(200, &txSlots, tx)`. Just change constant or get more transactions in loop until have free space in block.

thank you, got it. 
Indeed I changed it (increased to 500 and 600) batch of transactions increased accordingly. However anyway it behaves not as I expect. In result mining stops (if txpool has 600+ transactions ready to be mined). But this is a separate issue. 
Closing this one.
